Container.Name: phpldapadmin
Container.Overview: A docker image to run phpldapadmin. It provides a user interface to an openldap database. It must be on the same custom network as openldap and must be linked via --link openldap:PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_HOSTS e.g. --link openldap:example.org An example config.php can be found here: https://github.com/commandprompt/phpldapadmin/blob/master/config/config.php.example

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_HOSTS
Config.Description: Set in the phpldapadmin server config.php

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_HTTPS
Config.Description: Use apache ssl config. Defaults to true

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_HTTPS_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Apache ssl certificate filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/cert.pem

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_HTTPS_KEY_FILENAME
Config.Description: Apache ssl certificate private key filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/privkey.pem

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_HTTPS_CA_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Apache ssl CA certificate filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/fullchain.pem

Config.Name: LDAP SSL Certificate Path
Config.Description: Shared volume with Let's Encrypt certs. Create a docker volume -> docker create volume letsencrypt-keys, then link it in your linuxserver.io/letsencrypt docker container with container path: /config/etc/letsencrypt and host path: letsencrypt-keys

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_SERVER_PATH
Config.Description: Server path (useful if behind a reverse proxy). Defaults to /phpldapadmin

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_TRUST_PROXY_SSL
Config.Description: Set to true to trust X-Forwarded-Proto header

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS
Config.Description: Enable ldap client tls config, ldap server certificate check and set client certificate. Defaults to true

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_REQCERT
Config.Description: Set ldap.conf TLS_REQCERT. Defaults to demand

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_CA_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Set ldap.conf TLS_CACERT to /container/service/ldap-client/assets/certs/$PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_CA_CRT_FILENAME. Defaults to ldap-ca.crt

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Set .ldaprc TLS_CERT to /container/service/ldap-client/assets/certs/$PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_CRT_FILENAME. Defaults to ldap-client.crt

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_KEY_FILENAME
Config.Description: Set .ldaprc TLS_KEY to /container/service/ldap-client/assets/certs/$PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_CLIENT_TLS_KEY_FILENAME. Defaults to ldap-client.key

Config.Name: PHPLDAPADMIN_SSL_HELPER_PREFIX
Config.Description: ssl-helper environment variables prefix. Defaults to phpldapadmin, ssl-helper first search config from PHPLDAPADMIN_SSL_HELPER_* variables, before SSL_HELPER_* variables.

Config.Name: LDAP_CLIENT_SSL_HELPER_PREFIX
Config.Description: ssl-helper environment variables prefix. Defaults to ldap, ssl-helper first search config from LDAP_SSL_HELPER_* variables, before SSL_HELPER_* variables.

Config.Name: Appdata
Config.Description: Place your config.php in this path after setting up basic stuff in it like a hostname value
